intro: Pycnandra blaffartii, commonly known as the African yellowwood, is a small evergreen shrub native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its dense, compact growth habit and yellowish-green foliage. The plant produces small, white flowers that are clustered in umbels, followed by small, round berries. It is well adapted to dry conditions and is often found in rocky or sandy soils. Due to its ornamental value and hardiness, it is occasionally cultivated in warm climates.
